## Earn Your Montana CDL at SAGE – Billings, MT

SAGE Truck Driving Schools in Billings, MT offers the highest standard in
hands-on CDL training. If you want to make more money as a professional truck
driver, SAGE provides fast, focused truck driver training in all of Montana.
Get your Montana CDL license and start a new, great paying career in trucking!

Approved for veteran’s education training

### Address

#### Sage Truck Driving Schools

2110 Overland Ave, Suite 103  
Billings, MT 59102

### Phone

##

### Excellent Income and Benefits in Trucking

## WHY CHOOSE TRUCK DRIVING?

With demand for truck drivers at an all–time high, trucking firms and other
commercial carriers are offering new drivers higher mileage pay rates and
better benefit packages. A first year income of over $40,000 for a tractor
trailer driver is typical. Highly motivated drivers can earn even more!

Speak to a Representative

##  Benefits of CDL Training at SAGE in Billings, MT

### Hands–On CDL Training

The SAGE driver–training program provides students with the ideal mix of
classroom and “hands-on” training. The program is modeled upon the curriculum
developed by the U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT).

### Get to Work as a Truck Driver Sooner

On average, programs can be completed in 4-8 weeks depending on student
availability, scheduling and SAGE location. This program fully meets the needs
of students with no prior knowledge or experience in truck driving.

### Industry-Leading Equipment and Facilities for Truck Driver Training

SAGE provides students with the same tractors and trailers used by today’s
leading trucking companies. And the school has driving pads that include
multiple turns, backing lanes and other features students practice on before
driving on public streets. This is one of the premier driver training
facilities in the country.

### Certification to Help You Get a Trucking Job

Upon successful completion of the program in accordance with Federal Motor
Carrier Safety Regulation 49 CFR 380.503 and pasSAGE of the MT Class A
Commercial Driver’s License graduates will be certified as an entry–level
tractor trailer driver.

### Exceptional Job Demand for Truck Drivers

The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics lists heavy truck drivers as an occupation
with high projected growth. According to the Bureau, “as the economy grows,
the demand for goods and services will increase and more truck drivers will be
needed to keep supply chains moving.” Trucking is considered to be one of the
top job categories according to industry statistics. The American Trucking
Association reports that through the year 2025 an estimated 890,000 drivers
will need to be hired; this means over 88,000 drivers will be needed each year
to meet industry growth and driver retirements. And there is no need to move:
live in Montana and take advantage of local, regional or national trucking job
opportunities!

### CDL Jobs Pre–Hire Program

Many students get pre–hired by a major trucking company as a truck driver
before starting class. This means your background has been reviewed by a major
hiring carrier, and all you have to do is obtain a commercial driver´s license
and meet final hiring requirements.

### ON THE ROAD TRAINING FOR THE MT CDL Test

In our SAGE program, each student receives over the road training with an
experienced instructor.

### JOB PLACEMENT ASSISTANCE

We help SAGE students and graduates with locating a job by taking advantage of
our local, regional, and national employer network.

## Companies We Work With

### Kick your career into high gear

Thousands of SAGE graduates are hired every year by the best companies with
high-paying, middle-class trucking jobs.

### Total CDL Training Solution

SAGE can help you earn your Class A, Class B and Class B to A CDL, and
provides access to ProDriverU for additional endorsements such as tankers,
flatbeds and double-triple trailers.

### #1 Rated CDL School

SAGE is rated as #1 “Editors’ Choice” school by the leading internet CDL
training guide, TruckSchoolsUSA.com.

### Self-Paced, High Tech Learning Solutions

Utilizing ProDriverU, SAGE offers computer-based tools that cover all
Commercial Driver's License course subjects required by ELDT standards with
automatic reporting to the TPR. Various study guides are available for your
Permit Prep and endorsements such as doubles/triples and tankers. For those
that choose to add Hazmat to their commercial Driver's Licence, ProDriverU
offers an online curriculum that satisfies Federal and State requirements
prior to taking the State administered knowledge test for the H endorsement.

### Get a Trucking Job Fast

Trucking job placement assistance from a trusted leader with local, regional,
and national employer network.

### Get Paid Back for CDL Training Costs

Successful graduates who obtain employment with a major carrier, may be
eligible for employer-paid CDL training reimbursement.

### Easy Financial Assistance to Earn Your CDL

SAGE Commercial driver's license programs are an affordable value, and
financial assistance is easier than you think for those who qualify.

### Get Pre-Hired as a Truck Driver

We can get you pre-approved with major trucking companies before you start.

Start Your Trucking Career

Notice of Right to Opt Out

#### Third-Party Cookies and Sharing

Like many companies, we allow certain third-party advertising partners to
place tracking technology such as cookies and pixels on our websites. This
technology allows these advertising partners to receive information about your
activities on our website, which is then associated with your browser, device,
or online identifier. These companies may use this data to serve you more
relevant ads as you browse the internet.

#### Your Right to Opt-Out

Under California privacy law, you have the right to opt out of sharing data
for targeted online advertising. You can exercise your right to opt-out by
clicking Do Not Share My Personal Information. If you opt-out, you will still
see ads but they will not be personalized based on your online activity.
Please note that if you disable your cookies or upgrade your browser after
opting out, you will need to opt-out again. Further, if you use multiple
browsers or devices you will need to execute this opt-out on each browser or
device. Additionally, when we detect a Global Privacy Control (GPC) signal
from a user’s browser within California, we stop sharing the user’s personal
information online with other companies (except with our service providers).
You can learn more about the GPC and how to enable it in your browser from the
Global Privacy Control website.

You can also generally opt-out of receiving targeted ads from third-party
advertisers and ad networks who are members of the Network Advertising
Initiative (NAI) by visiting http://optout.networkadvertising.org/. You may
opt-out of receiving targeted advertisements from other companies that perform
interest-based advertising services, including some that we may work with, via
the Digital Advertising Alliance (DAA) site at http://optout.aboutads.info/.
